IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
Maryland State Police
Princess Anne Barrack “X”
Tpr. Carew, IBM 7074
Field Operation Bureau
09/07/2023
 

Maryland State Police Patrol Vehicle: X-34 is a marked 2022 Ford Explorer equipped with MVR system.
Type of Report: DOG COMPLAINT


Trooper’s Training/Experience:


* Trained in administering Standardized Field Sobriety Tests through the Maryland State Police and National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA).

* Trained and certified to operate Radar and LiDAR through the Maryland State Police.

* NHTSA certified in Advanced Roadside Impaired Driving Enforcement (A.R.I.D.E).

* Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration (FMCSA) certified commercial vehicle weights officer.

* FMCSA certified North American Standard (NAS) Level III Commercial Vehicle Inspector.

* Preliminary Breath Tech Operator through the Maryland State Police
 

Crime Scene Processing:



Narrative:

This report has been prepared based upon the observations of this trooper and/or those of other troopers relative to the offense(s). The facts contained herein are intended solely to give the prosecuting authority a basic understanding of the facts pertaining to the case. The facts contained herein are not intended to be an exhaustive recitation of the facts pertaining to pretrial or trial issues. Instead, this trooper anticipates that during the pretrial proceedings, in this case, the prosecutor will take the opportunity to interview this trooper in order to ascertain any and all relevant facts which might be the subject of this trooper’s testimony during court proceedings.

///
 
    On 9/7/2023 at approximately 2000 hours, the Maryland State Police Princess Anne Barrack received a call about two loose pit-bulls running around 30897 Eden Allen Rd, Eden Somerset County, Maryland. S/Tpr. Marshall and I responded to the area.

    Upon arriving on scene I made contact with the homeowner who advised that the two dogs had previously killed their cat and believed the dogs belonged to the address of 30821 Eden Allen Rd. The caller was Connie Miller. While at the residence of 30897 Eden Allen Road, I observed the two pit-bull walking around, the dogs at this time did not appear aggressive. I then proceeded to 30821 Eden Allen Rd and made contact with Theresa "Terry" Harmon (2/F DOB: 6/17/1962) who advised their cat had been attacked by the two pit-bulls, and they were rushing the cat to the PetER. Harmon advised the dogs belonged at 30893 Eden Allen Rd. S/Tpr. Marshall and I began to search for the dogs while Somerset County Animal Control was contacted to respond to the scene. Sgt. Redding of the Princess Anne Police Department responded to the scene to assist with gaining control of the dogs due to being a K9 handler. We were able to locate the dogs and take control of them.

    Once Animal Control arrived on scene they took possession of the two pit-bulls and responded over the 30893 Eden Allen Rd. Upon arriving at 30893 Eden Allen Rd we made contact with the residents and advised them of the dogs being out and that they had attacked another cat. Animal Control then advised they would be taking the puppies which were located on the steps outside the residence and they had no shelter or protection. Animal Control took possession of all animals with no incident. 

    A brief Incident Report was completed due to the incident.       


Charges:

  • Case referred to Somerset Animal Control.


Attachments:

  • N/A


ALL EVENTS OCCURRED IN SOMERSET COUNTY, MARYLAND.

I request this case be closed.
